project.teaser: Increasing evidence shows that disinformation spreading has non-negligible impact on our society at individual and collective levels. From public health to climate change, it is of paramount importance to timely identify emerging disinformation signals such as content from...
project.objective: Increasing evidence shows that disinformation spreading has non-negligible impact on our society at individual and collective levels. From public health to climate change, it is of paramount importance to timely identify emerging disinformation signals such as content from known unreliable sources and new narratives, especially from online social media, to provide media professionals and policy makers with trustworthy elements to extinguish disinformation outbreaks before they run out of control. However, monitoring and analyzing large volumes of online content is well beyond the capacity of human ability only. In fact, regardless of the socio-psychological and behavioral reasons behind information forging, the rate at which disinformation is produced is much larger than the rate at which it can be analyzed and its effects adequately mitigated. AI4TRUST will provide a hybrid system, where machines cooperate with humans, relying on advanced AI solutions against advanced disinformation techniques to support media professionals and policy makers. Our system will monitor, in nearly real time, multiple online social platforms, filtering out social noise and analyzing multimodal (text, audio, visual) content in multiple languages (up to 70% of coverage in EU) with novel AI algorithms, while cooperating in an automated way with an international network of human fact-checkers who will be periodically triggered and who will frequently provide validated data to update our algorithms. The resulting quantitative indicators, including infodemic risk, will be inspected under the lens of social and computational social sciences, to build the trustworthy elements required by media professionals to create customizable and reliable data reports. We expect that the AI4TRUST's system, based on a human-centred approach to technology development that is aligned with European social and ethical values, will be integrated in the standard toolbox of data analysts working on disinformation.
project.title: AI-based-technologies for trustworthy solutions against disinformation
project.keywords: Complex Networks, Infodemics, Multimedia Analysis, Social Phenomena

result.title: Pilot planning report
result.description: This deliverable will illustrate the detailed piloting requirements, planning, and KPI definition.

result.title: AI4TRUST Platform Specification
result.description: This deliverable will provide the system specifications as detailed in T5.1. The initial release will focus on the most relevant components and will be progressively updated to reflect the evolution of the AI4TRUST APIs.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - AI4TRUST (AI-based-technologies for trustworthy solutions against disinformation)
result.teaser: The AI4TRUST project aims to combat disinformation, misinformation, and malinformation in the European Union (EU) by fostering a trust-based environment that integrates automated monitoring of social and news media with advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies to...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: First release of AI tools for disinformation detection
result.description: This deliverable will include the first release of T3.1-T3.4 and will also report on the exposed APIs for the integration of some of these technologies in the AI4TRUST platform.

result.title: Benchmarking the Generation of Fact Checking Explanations

details.authors: Russo, Daniel; Tekiroğlu, Serra Sinem; Guerini, Marco

result.title: Ground truth data and social listening data streams
result.description: The access to ground data collected by the Human Fact-Checking network, as well as the one collected from social listening data streams, will be provided, in the earliest stages of the project to all technical members of the consortium to bootstrap the R&D.

result.title: Explainability and Transparency report and AI tools
result.description: This deliverable will report results of T4.1-T4.2 to outline the explainability and transparency needs for the AI4TRUST platform and the socio-linguistic, user contextual, and social network factors of design for disinformation and mitigating misinformation. It will also include the first version of Trustworthy AI algorithms produced in T4.3.

result.title: Pilot planning report - Revised version
result.description: This deliverable will provide an updated version of D6.1, revised according to the recommendations given by the external experts at the RP1 review.

result.title: AI4TRUST Platform v1
result.description: This deliverable constitutes the initial release of the AI4TRUST platform. It will also include the adopted ethical, privacy and data protection compliance technical measures as defined in T5.2 and will formalise the availability of the most relevant components. The SW modules, as well as the platform specification devised in T5.1, will be enhanced and updated at M32 (Enhanced version).

result.title: Weakly-supervised deepfake localization in diffusion-generated images

details.authors: Tantaru, Dragos; Oneata, Elisabeta; Oneata, Dan

result.title: First report on social dynamics of misinformation
result.description: This deliverable will report the first version of the findings of T4.1 on the socio-contextual basis for misinformation.

result.title: Piloting sessions report v1
result.description: This deliverable describes the experimentation and validation of the AI4TRUST Platform v1 and v2-3 through its usage in the three piloting sessions. It includes an update of the planning and methodology devised in T6.1.

result.title: AI4TRUST Communication and Dissemination Plan
result.description: Strategic document setting the communication and dissemination strategy of the project, including key indicators, roles and responsibilities.

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Report v1
result.description: The v1 (M20) will include some results of the first half of the project communication and dissemina-tion activities, also including i) the clustering activities within T7.4; ii) the Kick-off Conference and Stakeholder Workshop (M18). The final version of this deliverable (M36) will contain the final results including: i) the proceedings of the Final Stakeholder Forum and Policy Workshop, and iii) the reach of the SKYTG24 miniseries.

result.title: Platform Specification -- Revised version
result.description: This deliverable will provide an updated version of D5.4, revised according to the recommendations given by the external experts at the RP1 review.

result.title: AI4TRUST Platform v2
result.description: This deliverable constitutes the enhanced release of the AI4TRUST platform. It will also include the updated ethical, privacy and data protection compliance technical measures as defined in T5.2 and will formalise the availability of the most relevant components. The SW modules, as well as the platform specification devised in T5.1 and T5.2, will be enhanced and updated at M38 (Final version).

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
